title: Sinusoidal Function Modeling - Windmill - Part C

content.description:
The blades of a windmill rotate in a clockwise direction and complete one rotation every <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>6</mn> </math> seconds. Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>B</mn> </math> is on the tip of one of the windmill blades and is located directly above the center of the windmill at time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3901@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, as indicated in the figure. Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>B</mn> </math> is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>40</mn> </math> meters from the center of the windmill. The center of the windmill is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>75</mn> </math> meters above the level ground. As the windmill blades rotate at a constant speed, the distance between <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>B</mn> </math> and the ground periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> models the distance between <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>B</mn> </math> and the ground, in meters, as a function of time <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>t</mn> </math>, in seconds.
content.question:
Part C

Refer to the graph of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> in part (A). The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>t</mn> </math>-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>G</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3829@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the \(t\)-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>J</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaaa@382A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> ?

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and increasing.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and decreasing.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and increasing.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and decreasing.

(ii) Describe how the rate of change of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is changing on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
Part C

Refer to the graph of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> in part (A). The <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>t</mn> </math>-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>G</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3829@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the \(t\)-coordinate of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>J</mn> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaaa@382A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> ?

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and increasing.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is positive and decreasing.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and increasing.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is negative and decreasing.

(ii) Describe how the rate of change of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>h</mn> </math> is changing on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
